subject: RE: [junit] Do i really need to write a Test Class ????
msgSnippet: If you generate the tests automatically, how would you know what the predicted outcome is? Thanks --DP ... From: Girish Patil [mailto:sairamgirish@yahoo.com]
messageBody:
If you generate the tests automatically, how would you know what the
predicted outcome is?


Thanks
--DP

-----Original Message-----
From: Girish Patil [mailto:sairamgirish@...]
Sent: Tuesday, June 08, 2004 2:37 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Do i really need to write a Test Class ????


Hello Everybody,

I use Junit for Unit Testing my Code.
During Development, whenever there is new method is
writtten or existing code is changed i write Junit
Test class and test it.The same approach is taken by
me for Unit testing the Server side code like session
beans using cactus(Extension to Junit).

But over a period of Time i feel why to mannually
write the test Code ???

what i understand from unit Testing the code is,
---
"MAKE SURE YOUR CODE(METHOD) DOSE NOT BREAK IN ALL
POSSIBLE SCENARIOS AND IT RETURNS APPROPRIATE RESULTS
TO YOU"

taking above point, i write testMethod with all
possible combinations and run the test For Example

1) myMethod(String val1,int val2)

To Test above method i create a Test methods with

testMyMethod(null,0)
testMyMethod("",3456799)
testMyMethod("valid_string",234)
and so on......

Thus i am making sure that all possible
combinations my code do not break

2) But writing these TestMethods take lot of Time

WHAT IF I GENERATE THE TEST CLASSES DYNAMICALLY WHERE
I JUST GIVE CALLS TO ACTUAL METHODS WITH ALL POSSIBLE
COMBINATIONS WITH OUT WRITTING TEST CODE.

I CAN GENERATE TEST CALLS TO THESE METHODS DYNAMICALLY
AND TEST THEIR VALIDITY

PLEASE LET ME KNOW YOUR VIEWS ON THE SAME

THIS APPROACH WOULD SAVE A LOT OF DEVELOPERS TIME



THANKS AND REGARDS
GIRISH G PATIL
